meaningMnemonic:
Being <kanji>courteous</kanji> is the right <kanji>idea</kanji> if you want to be on <vocabulary>friendly</vocabulary> terms with others. The more courteous you are to someone (and vice versa), the more a sense of <vocabulary>closeness</vocabulary> grows between you.

懇意 formally describes being on good, cordial terms with someone. You might talk about a colleague you've become friendly with (懇意になった同僚) or a professor who treats you warmly (懇意にしてくれる教授), for example.
